job.title: Senior Site Reliability Engineer (SRE)
job.description:
Quil, a digital health company, delivers actionable and personalized health itineraries for patients and caregivers, answering the question “What Happens Next?” in their healthcare journeys. We combine the powers of precision data, state-of-the-art technology, and security with unparalleled consumer reach to help individuals navigate today’s chaotic healthcare landscape. Headquartered in Philadelphia, PA, Quil is a joint venture of Comcast and Independence Health Group (Independence).
We are seeking an experienced Site Reliability Engineer to join our rapidly growing organization. In this role, the engineer will develop software solutions to operations problems, embedding in development teams, and perform operations work. The selected candidate will be responsible for building developer tooling, APIs, infrastructure, pipelines, testing, monitoring, and all other tooling necessary to ship high quality code in an Agile environment.
As a member of the Site Reliability Engineering team, you will:
Write software to automate the entire lifecycle of production microservices and the environments they run on
Tackle architectural challenges around highly available services and data
Ensure our infrastructure and services are sufficiently observable
Continue to learn and expand your knowledge and skill set
You have the skills to be successful in this role if you have:
Generally 5+ years of software development experience
Writen code with empathy for the next person
Previous experience in operating production systems, ideally including node.js or JVM services
Bachelor of Science degree or greater in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or another related field, or equivalent experience
Experience in one or more of the following: node.js, Java, Python, Go, PHP or Ruby
Desire to join a highly technical team in a fast-paced environment
Proven track record of ownership of maintainable, stable and scalable software
Expertise managing AWS infrastructure
Good understanding of continuous delivery
Good understanding of Monitoring/Alerting tools and best practices
It is a plus if you have:
Run Kubernetes in production
Familiarity with managing Kafka, Elastic Search, RDS, DynamoDB
Experience with AWS Lambda
Contributed to existing open-source projects as well as your own
Experience with Docker and/or Linux Containers
Experience with Microservices/SOA
Experience with HIPAA or SOC2
Personal Requirements:
Curiosity and interest in investigating issues to reveal their root causes
Have strong opinions that are loosely held
Work constructively in a distributed team and collaborate effectively
